alpha protocol amid todays dull timewasting games feels like a breath of fresh air its absolutely janky and the enemies are dumb but the sense of control and power fantasy you get over enemies with the right playstyle kept me hooked the storys decent progression felt satisfying and i dont recall being this engaged with ingame emails plus choices genuinely affect outcome in this game which is cool  8010

super under valued its shame the game didt do to well when it came out sure its a little janky in some places but the story and various choice outcomes from dialogue or simply the order you choose to complete the missions is all rather interesting also aware of the spelling errors im just far to lazy to correct them

alpha protocol has been and still is one of the best spy rpgs to ever be grafted onto memory its an absolute shame that the sequel got canned but i still hold hope that one day this game will get either the sequel or remaster that it truly deserves

if syphon filter and bourne identity had a baby this would be it this game is awesome because the choices you make in this game actually matter i wish there was a sequel because they just dont make games like this anymore i have played this game on console and now here on steam its always been one of my favorites i like the fact that you can romance the womens in this game too factor in fun action and gunfights and you have a great rpgish game

embrace ignore the jank and be rewarded with one of the most reactive rpgs narrative of all time

710 nice to see this flawed but somewhat underrated stealth action game come back after being delisted probably licensed music story was predictable but it was interesting to see how some choices and the order of missions chosen would change how certain level aspects or parts of the story would change wasnt worth full price when it came out but for 20 or less its a good spy thriller themed third person shooter
